titles.title: Bone Marrow Donor Program Reauthorization Act of 1993
A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend the bone marrow donor program, and for other purposes.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: 11/22/1993--Introduced. Bone Marrow Donor Program Reauthorization Act of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to provide for the terms of office for members of the board of the National Bone Marrow Donor Registry. Modifies Registry functions. Authorizes grants and contracts to increase bone marrow donation, including through public education, training individuals in requesting donations, and testing and enrolling marrow donors. Authorizes appropriations. Mandates establishment, through grant or contract, of an office of patient advocacy and case management. (Current law requires the Registry to establish a system for patient advocacy.)
